title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Harper Lee's masterpiece explores racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: One of the most beloved novels in English literature, Pride and Prejudice follows the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet.

author: George Orwell
description: George Orwell's dystopian novel about the dangers of totalitarianism, censorship, and surveillance.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A controversial novel following Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager, through his adventures in New York City.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel exploring themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of obsession and revenge, centered around the monomaniacal Captain Ahab's pursuit of the great white whale.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: Charlotte Brontë's classic novel follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine as she matures into adulthood.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Mary Shelley's groundbreaking novel exploring the consequences of scientific ambition and the nature of humanity.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: Emily Brontë's haunting tale of love, revenge, and the destructive power of passion set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: Oscar Wilde's only novel, exploring the nature of beauty, morality, and the pursuit of pleasure.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel set in a future society where citizens are engineered through eugenics and conditioned to be content with their roles in the world.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic high-fantasy novel follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved children's fantasy novel follows Bilbo Baggins on an unexpected adventure to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and its treasure from the dragon Smaug.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first novel in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series, chronicling the young wizard's first year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The second novel in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series, following Harry's second year at Hogwarts and his encounter with the mysterious Chamber of Secrets.

author: George Orwell
description: George Orwell's dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, where individuality and free thought are suppressed by the omnipresent Big Brother.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel depicting a future society where citizens are engineered and conditioned for conformity and stability.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: William Golding's allegorical novel exploring the descent into savagery of a group of British boys stranded on a deserted island.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The sixth novel in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series, delving into the past and secrets of Lord Voldemort while Harry prepares for the final confrontation.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The seventh and final novel in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series, chronicling Harry's quest to destroy the remaining Horcruxes and defeat Voldemort.
